abstract: A study from Consumer Reports says that a majority of U.S. Internet users, 52 percent, have posted information that puts them at risk of cybercrime on Facebook and social networks.
snippet: A study from Consumer Reports says that a majority of U.S. Internet users, 52 percent, have posted information that puts them at risk of cybercrime on Facebook and social networks.
lead_paragraph: 6:30 P.M. Updated with response from Facebook.

headline.main: Majority of Americans Post Risky Information Online, Study Says
